content: 1 James, of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ a servant, to the Twelve Tribes who are in the dispersion: Hail!
content_old: 1 James, of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ a servant, to the Twelve Tribes who are in the dispersion: Hail!

content: 2 All joy count it, my brethren, when ye may fall into temptations manifold;
content_old: 2 All joy count it, my brethren, when ye may fall into temptations manifold;

content: 3 knowing that the proof of your faith doth work endurance,
content_old: 3 knowing that the proof of your faith doth work endurance,

content: 4 and let the endurance have a perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire—in nothing lacking;
content_old: 4 and let the endurance have a perfect work, that ye may be perfect and entire—in nothing lacking;

content: 5 and if any of you do lack wisdom, let him ask from God, who is giving to all liberally, and not reproaching, and it shall be given to him;
content_old: 5 and if any of you do lack wisdom, let him ask from God, who is giving to all liberally, and not reproaching, and it shall be given to him;

content: 6 and let him ask in faith, nothing doubting, for he who is doubting hath been like a wave of the sea, driven by wind and tossed,
content_old: 6 and let him ask in faith, nothing doubting, for he who is doubting hath been like a wave of the sea, driven by wind and tossed,

content: 7 for let not that man suppose that he shall receive anything from the Lord—
content_old: 7 for let not that man suppose that he shall receive anything from the Lord—

content: 8 a two-souled man is unstable in all his ways.
content_old: 8 a two-souled man is unstable in all his ways.

content: 9 And let the brother who is low rejoice in his exaltation,
content_old: 9 And let the brother who is low rejoice in his exaltation,

content: 10 and the rich in his becoming low, because as a flower of grass he shall pass away;
content_old: 10 and the rich in his becoming low, because as a flower of grass he shall pass away;

content: 11 for the sun did rise with the burning heat, and did wither the grass, and the flower of it fell, and the grace of its appearance did perish, so also the rich in his way shall fade away!
content_old: 11 for the sun did rise with the burning heat, and did wither the grass, and the flower of it fell, and the grace of its appearance did perish, so also the rich in his way shall fade away!

content: 12 Happy the man who doth endure temptation, because, becoming approved, he shall receive the crown of the life, which the Lord did promise to those loving Him.
content_old: 12 Happy the man who doth endure temptation, because, becoming approved, he shall receive the crown of the life, which the Lord did promise to those loving Him.

content: 13 Let no one say, being tempted—‘From God I am tempted,’ for God is not tempted of evil, and Himself doth tempt no one,
content_old: 13 Let no one say, being tempted—‘From God I am tempted,’ for God is not tempted of evil, and Himself doth tempt no one,

content: 14 and each one is tempted, by his own desires being led away and enticed,
content_old: 14 and each one is tempted, by his own desires being led away and enticed,

content: 15 afterward the desire having conceived, doth give birth to sin, and the sin having been perfected, doth bring forth death.
content_old: 15 afterward the desire having conceived, doth give birth to sin, and the sin having been perfected, doth bring forth death.

content: 16 Be not led astray, my brethren beloved;
content_old: 16 Be not led astray, my brethren beloved;

content: 17 every good giving, and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the lights, with whom is no variation, or shadow of turning;
content_old: 17 every good giving, and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the lights, with whom is no variation, or shadow of turning;

content: 18 having counselled, He did beget us with a word of truth, for our being a certain first-fruit of His creatures.
content_old: 18 having counselled, He did beget us with a word of truth, for our being a certain first-fruit of His creatures.

content: 19 So then, my brethren beloved, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger,
content_old: 19 So then, my brethren beloved, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger,

content: 20 for the wrath of a man the righteousness of God doth not work;
content_old: 20 for the wrath of a man the righteousness of God doth not work;

content: 21 wherefore having put aside all filthiness and superabundance of evil, in meekness be receiving the engrafted word, that is able to save your souls;
content_old: 21 wherefore having put aside all filthiness and superabundance of evil, in meekness be receiving the engrafted word, that is able to save your souls;

content: 22 and become ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves,
content_old: 22 and become ye doers of the word, and not hearers only, deceiving yourselves,

content: 23 because, if any one is a hearer of the word and not a doer, this one hath been like to a man viewing his natural face in a mirror,
content_old: 23 because, if any one is a hearer of the word and not a doer, this one hath been like to a man viewing his natural face in a mirror,

content: 24 for he did view himself, and hath gone away, and immediately he did forget of what kind he was;
content_old: 24 for he did view himself, and hath gone away, and immediately he did forget of what kind he was;

content: 25 and he who did look into the perfect law—that of liberty, and did continue there, this one—not a forgetful hearer becoming, but a doer of work—this one shall be happy in his doing.
content_old: 25 and he who did look into the perfect law—that of liberty, and did continue there, this one—not a forgetful hearer becoming, but a doer of work—this one shall be happy in his doing.

content: 26 If any one doth think to be religious among you, not bridling his tongue, but deceiving his heart, of this one vain is the religion;
content_old: 26 If any one doth think to be religious among you, not bridling his tongue, but deceiving his heart, of this one vain is the religion;

content: 1 My brethren, hold not, in respect of persons, the faith of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ,
content_old: 1 My brethren, hold not, in respect of persons, the faith of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ,

content: 2 for if there may come into your synagogue a man with gold ring, in gay raiment, and there may come in also a poor man in vile raiment,
content_old: 2 for if there may come into your synagogue a man with gold ring, in gay raiment, and there may come in also a poor man in vile raiment,

content: 3 and ye may look upon him bearing the gay raiment, and may say to him, ‘Thou—sit thou here well,’ and to the poor man may say, ‘Thou—stand thou there, or, Sit thou here under my footstool,’—
content_old: 3 and ye may look upon him bearing the gay raiment, and may say to him, ‘Thou—sit thou here well,’ and to the poor man may say, ‘Thou—stand thou there, or, Sit thou here under my footstool,’—

content: 4 ye did not judge fully in yourselves, and did become ill-reasoning judges.
content_old: 4 ye did not judge fully in yourselves, and did become ill-reasoning judges.

content: 5 Hearken, my brethren beloved, did not God choose the poor of this world, rich in faith, and heirs of the reign that He promised to those loving Him?
content_old: 5 Hearken, my brethren beloved, did not God choose the poor of this world, rich in faith, and heirs of the reign that He promised to those loving Him?

content: 6 and ye did dishonour the poor one; do not the rich oppress you and themselves draw you to judgment-seats;
content_old: 6 and ye did dishonour the poor one; do not the rich oppress you and themselves draw you to judgment-seats;

content: 7 do they not themselves speak evil of the good name that was called upon you?
content_old: 7 do they not themselves speak evil of the good name that was called upon you?

content: 8 If, indeed, royal law ye complete, according to the Writing, ‘Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself,’—ye do well;
content_old: 8 If, indeed, royal law ye complete, according to the Writing, ‘Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself,’—ye do well;

content: 9 and if ye accept persons, sin ye do work, being convicted by the law as transgressors;
content_old: 9 and if ye accept persons, sin ye do work, being convicted by the law as transgressors;

content: 10 for whoever the whole law shall keep, and shall stumble in one point, he hath become guilty of all;
content_old: 10 for whoever the whole law shall keep, and shall stumble in one point, he hath become guilty of all;

content: 11 for He who is saying, ‘Thou mayest not commit adultery,’ said also, ‘Thou mayest do no murder;’ and if thou shalt not commit adultery, and shalt commit murder, thou hast become a transgressor of law;
content_old: 11 for He who is saying, ‘Thou mayest not commit adultery,’ said also, ‘Thou mayest do no murder;’ and if thou shalt not commit adultery, and shalt commit murder, thou hast become a transgressor of law;

content: 12 so speak ye and so do, as about by a law of liberty to be judged,
content_old: 12 so speak ye and so do, as about by a law of liberty to be judged,

content: 13 for the judgment without kindness is to him not having done kindness, and exult doth kindness over judgment.
content_old: 13 for the judgment without kindness is to him not having done kindness, and exult doth kindness over judgment.

content: 14 What is the profit, my brethren, if faith, any one may speak of having, and works he may not have? is that faith able to save him?
content_old: 14 What is the profit, my brethren, if faith, any one may speak of having, and works he may not have? is that faith able to save him?

content: 15 and if a brother or sister may be naked, and may be destitute of the daily food,
content_old: 15 and if a brother or sister may be naked, and may be destitute of the daily food,

content: 16 and any one of you may say to them, ‘Depart ye in peace, be warmed, and be filled,’ and may not give to them the things needful for the body, what is the profit?
content_old: 16 and any one of you may say to them, ‘Depart ye in peace, be warmed, and be filled,’ and may not give to them the things needful for the body, what is the profit?

content: 17 so also the faith, if it may not have works, is dead by itself.
content_old: 17 so also the faith, if it may not have works, is dead by itself.

content: 18 But say may some one, Thou hast faith, and I have works, shew me thy faith out of thy works, and I will shew thee out of my works my faith:
content_old: 18 But say may some one, Thou hast faith, and I have works, shew me thy faith out of thy works, and I will shew thee out of my works my faith:

content: 19 thou—thou dost believe that God is one; thou dost well, and the demons believe, and they shudder!
content_old: 19 thou—thou dost believe that God is one; thou dost well, and the demons believe, and they shudder!

content: 20 And dost thou wish to know, O vain man, that the faith apart from the works is dead?
content_old: 20 And dost thou wish to know, O vain man, that the faith apart from the works is dead?

content: 21 Abraham our father—was not he declared righteous out of works, having brought up Isaac his son upon the altar?
content_old: 21 Abraham our father—was not he declared righteous out of works, having brought up Isaac his son upon the altar?

content: 22 dost thou see that the faith was working with his works, and out of the works the faith was perfected?
content_old: 22 dost thou see that the faith was working with his works, and out of the works the faith was perfected?

content: 23 and fulfilled was the Writing that is saying, ‘And Abraham did believe God, and it was reckoned to him—to righteousness;’ and, ‘Friend of God’ he was called.
content_old: 23 and fulfilled was the Writing that is saying, ‘And Abraham did believe God, and it was reckoned to him—to righteousness;’ and, ‘Friend of God’ he was called.

content: 24 Ye see, then, that out of works is man declared righteous, and not out of faith only;
content_old: 24 Ye see, then, that out of works is man declared righteous, and not out of faith only;

content: 25 and in like manner also Rahab the harlot—was she not out of works declared righteous, having received the messengers, and by another way having sent forth?
content_old: 25 and in like manner also Rahab the harlot—was she not out of works declared righteous, having received the messengers, and by another way having sent forth?

content: 1 Many teachers become not, my brethren, having known that greater judgment we shall receive,
content_old: 1 Many teachers become not, my brethren, having known that greater judgment we shall receive,

content: 2 for we all make many stumbles; if any one in word doth not stumble, this one is a perfect man, able to bridle also the whole body;
content_old: 2 for we all make many stumbles; if any one in word doth not stumble, this one is a perfect man, able to bridle also the whole body;

content: 3 lo, the bits we put into the mouths of the horses for their obeying us, and their whole body we turn about;
content_old: 3 lo, the bits we put into the mouths of the horses for their obeying us, and their whole body we turn about;

content: 4 lo, also the ships, being so great, and by fierce winds being driven, are led about by a very small helm, whithersoever the impulse of the helmsman doth counsel,
content_old: 4 lo, also the ships, being so great, and by fierce winds being driven, are led about by a very small helm, whithersoever the impulse of the helmsman doth counsel,

content: 5 so also the tongue is a little member, and doth boast greatly; lo, a little fire how much wood it doth kindle!
content_old: 5 so also the tongue is a little member, and doth boast greatly; lo, a little fire how much wood it doth kindle!

content: 6 and the tongue is a fire, the world of the unrighteousness, so the tongue is set in our members, which is spotting our whole body, and is setting on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by the gehenna.
content_old: 6 and the tongue is a fire, the world of the unrighteousness, so the tongue is set in our members, which is spotting our whole body, and is setting on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by the gehenna.

content: 7 For every nature, both of beasts and of fowls, both of creeping things and things of the sea, is subdued, and hath been subdued, by the human nature,
content_old: 7 For every nature, both of beasts and of fowls, both of creeping things and things of the sea, is subdued, and hath been subdued, by the human nature,

content: 8 and the tongue no one of men is able to subdue, it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison,
content_old: 8 and the tongue no one of men is able to subdue, it is an unruly evil, full of deadly poison,

content: 9 with it we do bless the God and Father, and with it we do curse the men made according to the similitude of God;
content_old: 9 with it we do bless the God and Father, and with it we do curse the men made according to the similitude of God;

content: 10 out of the same mouth doth come forth blessing and cursing; it doth not need, my brethren, these things so to happen;
content_old: 10 out of the same mouth doth come forth blessing and cursing; it doth not need, my brethren, these things so to happen;

content: 11 doth the fountain out of the same opening pour forth the sweet and the bitter?
content_old: 11 doth the fountain out of the same opening pour forth the sweet and the bitter?

content: 12 is a fig-tree able, my brethren, olives to make? or a vine figs? so no fountain salt and sweet water is able to make.
content_old: 12 is a fig-tree able, my brethren, olives to make? or a vine figs? so no fountain salt and sweet water is able to make.

content: 13 Who is wise and intelligent among you? let him shew out of the good behaviour his works in meekness of wisdom,
content_old: 13 Who is wise and intelligent among you? let him shew out of the good behaviour his works in meekness of wisdom,

content: 14 and if bitter zeal ye have, and rivalry in your heart, glory not, nor lie against the truth;
content_old: 14 and if bitter zeal ye have, and rivalry in your heart, glory not, nor lie against the truth;

content: 15 this wisdom is not descending from above, but earthly, physical, demon-like,
content_old: 15 this wisdom is not descending from above, but earthly, physical, demon-like,

content: 16 for where zeal and rivalry are, there is insurrection and every evil matter;
content_old: 16 for where zeal and rivalry are, there is insurrection and every evil matter;

content: 17 and the wisdom from above, first, indeed, is pure, then peaceable, gentle, easily entreated, full of kindness and good fruits, uncontentious, and unhypocritical:—
content_old: 17 and the wisdom from above, first, indeed, is pure, then peaceable, gentle, easily entreated, full of kindness and good fruits, uncontentious, and unhypocritical:—

content: 1 Whence are wars and fightings among you? not thence—out of your passions, that are as soldiers in your members?
content_old: 1 Whence are wars and fightings among you? not thence—out of your passions, that are as soldiers in your members?

content: 2 ye desire, and ye have not; ye murder, and are zealous, and are not able to attain; ye fight and war, and ye have not, because of your not asking;
content_old: 2 ye desire, and ye have not; ye murder, and are zealous, and are not able to attain; ye fight and war, and ye have not, because of your not asking;

content: 3 ye ask, and ye receive not, because evilly ye ask, that in your pleasures ye may spend it.
content_old: 3 ye ask, and ye receive not, because evilly ye ask, that in your pleasures ye may spend it.

content: 4 Adulterers and adulteresses! have ye not known that friendship of the world is enmity with God? whoever, then, may counsel to be a friend of the world, an enemy of God he is set.
content_old: 4 Adulterers and adulteresses! have ye not known that friendship of the world is enmity with God? whoever, then, may counsel to be a friend of the world, an enemy of God he is set.

content: 5 Do ye think that emptily the Writing saith, ‘To envy earnestly desireth the spirit that did dwell in us,’
content_old: 5 Do ye think that emptily the Writing saith, ‘To envy earnestly desireth the spirit that did dwell in us,’

content: 6 and greater grace he doth give, wherefore he saith, ‘God against proud ones doth set Himself up, and to lowly ones He doth give grace?’
content_old: 6 and greater grace he doth give, wherefore he saith, ‘God against proud ones doth set Himself up, and to lowly ones He doth give grace?’

content: 7 be subject, then, to God; stand up against the devil, and he will flee from you;
content_old: 7 be subject, then, to God; stand up against the devil, and he will flee from you;

content: 8 draw nigh to God, and He will draw nigh to you; cleanse hands, ye sinners! and purify hearts, ye two-souled!
content_old: 8 draw nigh to God, and He will draw nigh to you; cleanse hands, ye sinners! and purify hearts, ye two-souled!

content: 9 be exceeding afflicted, and mourn, and weep, let your laughter to mourning be turned, and the joy to heaviness;
content_old: 9 be exceeding afflicted, and mourn, and weep, let your laughter to mourning be turned, and the joy to heaviness;

content: 10 be made low before the Lord, and He shall exalt you.
content_old: 10 be made low before the Lord, and He shall exalt you.

content: 11 Speak not one against another, brethren; he who is speaking against a brother, and is judging his brother, doth speak against law, and doth judge law, and if law thou dost judge, thou art not a doer of law but a judge;
content_old: 11 Speak not one against another, brethren; he who is speaking against a brother, and is judging his brother, doth speak against law, and doth judge law, and if law thou dost judge, thou art not a doer of law but a judge;

content: 12 one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy; thou—who art thou that dost judge the other?
content_old: 12 one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy; thou—who art thou that dost judge the other?

content: 13 Go, now, ye who are saying, ‘To-day and to-morrow we will go on to such a city, and will pass there one year, and traffic, and make gain;’
content_old: 13 Go, now, ye who are saying, ‘To-day and to-morrow we will go on to such a city, and will pass there one year, and traffic, and make gain;’

content: 14 who do not know the thing of the morrow; for what is your life? for it is a vapour that is appearing for a little, and then is vanishing;
content_old: 14 who do not know the thing of the morrow; for what is your life? for it is a vapour that is appearing for a little, and then is vanishing;

content: 15 instead of your saying, ‘If the Lord may will, we shall live, and do this or that;’
content_old: 15 instead of your saying, ‘If the Lord may will, we shall live, and do this or that;’

content: 16 and now ye glory in your pride; all such glorying is evil;
content_old: 16 and now ye glory in your pride; all such glorying is evil;

content: 1 Go, now, ye rich! weep, howling over your miseries that are coming upon you;
content_old: 1 Go, now, ye rich! weep, howling over your miseries that are coming upon you;

content: 2 your riches have rotted, and your garments have become moth-eaten;
content_old: 2 your riches have rotted, and your garments have become moth-eaten;

content: 3 your gold and silver have rotted, and the rust of them for a testimony shall be to you, and shall eat your flesh as fire. Ye made treasure in the last days!
content_old: 3 your gold and silver have rotted, and the rust of them for a testimony shall be to you, and shall eat your flesh as fire. Ye made treasure in the last days!

content: 4 lo, the reward of the workmen, of those who in-gathered your fields, which hath been fraudulently kept back by you—doth cry out, and the exclamations of those who did reap into the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth have entered;
content_old: 4 lo, the reward of the workmen, of those who in-gathered your fields, which hath been fraudulently kept back by you—doth cry out, and the exclamations of those who did reap into the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth have entered;

content: 5 ye did live in luxury upon the earth, and were wanton; ye did nourish your hearts, as in a day of slaughter;
content_old: 5 ye did live in luxury upon the earth, and were wanton; ye did nourish your hearts, as in a day of slaughter;

content: 6 ye did condemn—ye did murder the righteous one, he doth not resist you.
content_old: 6 ye did condemn—ye did murder the righteous one, he doth not resist you.

content: 7 Be patient, then, brethren, till the presence of the Lord; lo, the husbandman doth expect the precious fruit of the earth, being patient for it, till he may receive rain—early and latter;
content_old: 7 Be patient, then, brethren, till the presence of the Lord; lo, the husbandman doth expect the precious fruit of the earth, being patient for it, till he may receive rain—early and latter;

content: 8 be patient, ye also; establish your hearts, because the presence of the Lord hath drawn nigh;
content_old: 8 be patient, ye also; establish your hearts, because the presence of the Lord hath drawn nigh;

content: 9 murmur not against one another, brethren, that ye may not be condemned; lo, the Judge before the door hath stood.
content_old: 9 murmur not against one another, brethren, that ye may not be condemned; lo, the Judge before the door hath stood.

content: 10 An example take ye of the suffering of evil, my brethren, and of the patience, the prophets who did speak in the name of the Lord;
content_old: 10 An example take ye of the suffering of evil, my brethren, and of the patience, the prophets who did speak in the name of the Lord;

content: 11 lo, we call happy those who are enduring; the endurance of Job ye heard of, and the end of the Lord ye have seen, that very compassionate is the Lord, and pitying.
content_old: 11 lo, we call happy those who are enduring; the endurance of Job ye heard of, and the end of the Lord ye have seen, that very compassionate is the Lord, and pitying.

content: 12 And before all things, my brethren, do not swear, neither by the heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath, and let your Yes be Yes, and the No, No; that under judgment ye may not fall.
content_old: 12 And before all things, my brethren, do not swear, neither by the heaven, neither by the earth, neither by any other oath, and let your Yes be Yes, and the No, No; that under judgment ye may not fall.

content: 13 Doth any one suffer evil among you? let him pray; is any of good cheer? let him sing psalms;
content_old: 13 Doth any one suffer evil among you? let him pray; is any of good cheer? let him sing psalms;

content: 14 is any infirm among you? let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, having anointed him with oil, in the name of the Lord,
content_old: 14 is any infirm among you? let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, having anointed him with oil, in the name of the Lord,

content: 15 and the prayer of the faith shall save the distressed one, and the Lord shall raise him up, and if sins he may have committed, they shall be forgiven to him.
content_old: 15 and the prayer of the faith shall save the distressed one, and the Lord shall raise him up, and if sins he may have committed, they shall be forgiven to him.

content: 16 Be confessing to one another the trespasses, and be praying for one another, that ye may be healed; very strong is a working supplication of a righteous man;
content_old: 16 Be confessing to one another the trespasses, and be praying for one another, that ye may be healed; very strong is a working supplication of a righteous man;

content: 17 Elijah was a man like affected as we, and with prayer he did pray—not to rain, and it did not rain upon the land three years and six months;
content_old: 17 Elijah was a man like affected as we, and with prayer he did pray—not to rain, and it did not rain upon the land three years and six months;

content: 18 and again he did pray, and the heaven did give rain, and the land did bring forth her fruit.
content_old: 18 and again he did pray, and the heaven did give rain, and the land did bring forth her fruit.

content: 19 Brethren, if any among you may go astray from the truth, and any one may turn him back,
content_old: 19 Brethren, if any among you may go astray from the truth, and any one may turn him back,
